RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Possui graduação em Matemática Aplicada (1991), Mestrado em Meteorologia pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (1994) e Doutorado em Engenharia Aeronáutica e Mecânica pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1998). Atuou como representante da área de Propulsão Aeroespacial e Energia no Programa de Pós-Graduação em Engenharia Aeronáutica e mecânica do ITA (2013-2019) e foi chefe da Divisão de Engenharia Aeronáutica e Aeroespacial (2019-2020). Atualmente é professora titular do ITA, publicando trabalhos nos seguintes temas: sistemas ambientais aeronáuticos e CFD (Dinâmica de Fluidos Computacional).




https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7697-0965
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Licenciatura Em Matemática from Centro de Desenvolvimento de Tecnologia e Recursos Humanos (1991), master's at Meteorology from Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (1994) and ph.d. at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1998). Has experience in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on Transference of Heat, acting on the following subjects: sistemas ambientais aeronáuticos, cfd, elementos finitos, computational fluid dynamics (cfd) and finite element method.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Análise de Proteção Térmica por Ablação
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto, com período de execução de outubro de 2000 a setembro de 2002, teve como objetivo o
desenvolvimento de um programa computacional para cálculo do fenômeno de ablação que ocorre em uma proteção
térmica de um microsatélite recuperável (satélites de retorno à superfície terrestre). Foi utilizada uma abordagem entálpica
considerando o problema transiente bidimensional e usando a técnica de elementos finitos com refinamento adaptativo de
uma malha não-estruturada com elementos triangulares. Essa ferramenta computacional forneceu informações para o
projeto e otimização da proteção térmica de veículos espaciais em condições de entrada atmosférica. .

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Turbinas a Gás Industriais e Sua Utilização em Usinas Térmicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto visa, portanto, estabelecer atividades de cooperação entre o ITA e a empresa El Paso Rio Claro, pertencente ao grupo El Paso Energy, criando um canal que permita ao ITA contribuir com a formação de recursos humanos direcionados para desenvolver, adquirir e transferir conhecimentos de interesse para a empresa com o objetivo de capacitá-las para a solução sistemática de problemas e para a experimentação com novas abordagens.
Este canal, por sua vez, permitirá o fortalecimento de áreas de atuação do ITA, na medida em que a empresa colabora com recursos financeiros para serem aplicados no melhoramento da infra-estrutura dos laboratórios, dos recursos de informática disponíveis e da biblioteca, mediante fornecimento de bolsas para alunos, de graduação e de pós-graduação, permitindo que professores se dediquem seus esforços acadêmicos e de pesquisa para o fortalecimento
desta parceria.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Análise das Tecnologias de Captura de Dióxido de Carbono (CO2) e seus Efeitos no Desempenho das Turbinas a Gás
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O objetivo principal deste projeto de pesquisa é analisar as tecnologias para redução da emissão de CO2 em usinas térmicas devido à queima de combustíveis fósseis e investigar os seus efeitos no desempenho das turbinas a gás. Através do desenvolvimento do projeto pretende-se formar recursos humanos com conhecimento e capacitação especializados na tecnologia de turbina a gás no Brasil, em especial àquela associada com as usinas termelétricas.
Pretende-se ainda desenvolver atividades de pesquisa complementares para dar continuidade à operação do Centro de Referência El Paso de Turbinas a Gás, cujo projeto de implantação foi financiado e aprovado pela Aneel.
A pesquisa sobre os métodos para separação, captura e utilização do CO2 se justifica pois, desde o início da Revolução Industrial, a concentração de dióxido de carbono (CO2) na atmosfera tem crescido em função, principalmente, da queima de combustíveis fósseis. O aumento da concentração de CO2 acarreta mudanças climáticas na Terra porque contribui de forma significativa para a intensificação do efeito estufa e conseqüente aumento da temperatura média da atmosfera. Devido a esses problemas, faz-se necessária a inserção de alternativas para a redução nos níveis de emissão. Em 1997, os governantes de vários países adotaram o protocolo de Kyoto, onde se comprometeram a reduzir a emissão de gases que induzem o efeito estufa no período de 2008 a 2012. Cerca de 85% dessas emissões resultam de atividades de produção e uso de energia. A partir deste documento, tornou-se uma necessidade iminente a redução significativa na emissão do setor energético em vários países. Os EUA e alguns países da Europa já possuem programas operacionais de elevação da eficiência dos equipamentos de geração de potência elétrica levando em conta seus impactos ambientais.
No caso específico do Brasil, até o momento, a maior parte da energia elétrica é gerada através de usinas hidrelétricas cuja emissão de CO2 se deve à degradação de matéria or

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CAPTAER I - capacitação tecnológica e formação de recursos humanos para o setor aeronáutico
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Neste projeto de pesquisa (Captaer), suportado pela FINEP, existem duas metas físicas associadas à implantação de dois laboratórios de Sistemas Ambientais (experimental e computacional).
Este laboratório de Sistemas Ambientais Aeronáuticos tem por objetivo o desenvolvimento de métodos testados aplicados à simulação e ensaio de sistemas de controle ambiental de aviões. Devido às características dos equipamentos utilizados nos aviões, o projeto deve ser baseado na simulação dos fenômenos físicos utilizando procedimentos / ferramentas atualizadas e adequadas à complexidade dos processos envolvidos.
Na parte experimental (Meta Física 3), devem ser adotados procedimentos de medida e ajustes para uma correta sintonização destes sistemas, de acordo com as normas de certificação e ensaio.
Na parte computacional (Meta Física 6), além da avaliação de desempenho serão simuladas possíveis falhas nos componentes dos sistemas ambientais avaliando-se os danos causados em outros sistemas do avião, como controle, combustíveis, estrutura, risco de incêndio.
Estas pesquisas visam obter os seguintes resultados:
- desenvolvimento de procedimentos de projeto.
- redução no tempo de desenvolvimento de produtos.
- avaliação de alternativas tecnológicas.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Simulação de Sistemas Fluido-Térmicos em Aeronaves
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Resumo

Este projeto de pesquisa aborda dois sub-sistemas da aeronaves: supressão de fogo e pressurização da cabine. 
Durante o projeto de uma aeronave, os aspectos de segurança são um dos principais itens a serem considerados. Vários acidentes aéreos ocorreram por falta de procedimentos na presença de fogo em vôo. Atualmente, a maioria dos aviões possui uma classificação que exige a presença de sistema supressor de fogo. Esse sistema é constituído de garrafas, onde o agente extintor (halon) fica armazenado, sendo expelido para sob estado gasoso através de bicos de saída. 
Outro sub-sistema de fundamental importância na aeronave é o sistema de pressurização da cabine. Apesar de vantajoso, o vôo em altas altitudes faz com que a taxa de absorção de oxigênio pelo sangue dos pulmões fique reduzida devido à queda na pressão parcial do oxigênio. Assim, é preciso controlar a pressão interna da cabine de passageiros, injetando ar em seu interior (via sistema de ar condicionado) e modulando a saída através de uma válvula de exaustão. 
Neste contexto, o objetivo deste projeto de pesquisa é a simulação computacional dos sistemas de supressão de fogo no compartimento de carga e de controle de pressurização da cabine.
Para o sistema de supressão de fogo, pretende-se calcular a distribuição espacial/temporal tanto do agente extintor como da massa de ar no compartimento de carga, através de uma modelagem usando CFD. O sistema constituído pelas equações de conservação de massa, momentum, energia e transporte de espécies será resolvido numericamente utilizando a técnica de volumes finitos. Os resultados obtidos com o modelo distribuído serão comparados com a solução obtida através da aproximação de parâmetros concentrados. Essa comparação tem por objetivo verificar a faixa de validade da abordagem de parâmetros concentrados, que exige esforço e tempo computacionais muito mais reduzidos em relação à solução com parâmetros distribuídos. 
Este projeto foi contemplado pelas Bolsas de Produtividade em pesquisa - 2004-2006 e 
2007-2009
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Simulação de Sistemas Fluido-Térmicos em Aeronaves

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto CAPES/PROCAD - Otimização de Projeto de Turbomáquinas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O presente trabalho será realizado em um contexto de um programa de pós-graduação conjunto para formar novos profissionais de ensino e pesquisa com uma completa compreensão da complexidade envolvida no projeto de turbomáquinas, cujo desempenho é decorrente de como os escoamentos se processam nessas máquinas.A análise da transferência de calor em turbomáquinas é de fundamental importância para o seu projeto. Isto é ainda mais relevante para o projeto e otimização de turbinas a gás (TG) de alta temperatura. Altas temperaturas na entrada da turbina (saída da câmara de combustão) viabilizam alta eficiência térmica e também alta potência específica. As altas temperaturas de entrada da turbina e o resfriamento de suas partes mais aquecidas afeta fortemente o desempenho de turbojatos, turbofans, turboprops e turbinas a gás para aplicações industriais e em termelétricas. Os materiais atualmente utilizados não suportam temperaturas acima de 1300 K, mas a máxima temperatura do fluido de trabalho no ciclo pode ser aumentada pelo resfriamento. Portanto, os componentes resfriados (revestimento da câmara de combustão, pás e paredes, bocais de exaustão, discos, etc) são amplamente usados na indústria de turbinas a gás. A incorporação do resfriamento e melhoria dos materiais resultou em um aumento de entrada da turbina de mais de 750 K desde 1960. Assim, a temperatura de entrada da turbina em TG avançadas tem aumentado em uma taxa média de 20 K/ano e pelo menos metade deste aumento foi viabilizado pelas melhorias nos mecanismos de resfriamento dos componentes das turbinas. Associado a este aumento de desempenho descrito acima, existem complexidades mecânicas, aerodinâmicas e termodinâmicas ligadas ao projeto e análise dos furos e passagens para o resfriamento. Além disso, a sangria de ar de alta pressão e o método de resfriamento causam redução na eficiência térmica. Mesmo assim, as vantagens do resfriamento superam as desvantagens tanto em turbinas a gás para aplicações aeroespaci

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de Aplicativos de Subsistemas Aeronáuticos e Consolidação de Labs. do CAPTAER - I
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Descrição: Meta Física 11 - 
Os sistemas ambientais aeronáuticos (ar condicionado, pressurização, oxigênio emergencial, anti-gelo, anti-fogo e pneumático) impactam o desempenho da aeronave, seja através de peso e volume ocupados ou diretamente pelo consumo de energia produzida na turbina a gás queimando combustível.
O projeto e otimização destes sistemas é um requisito fundamental para o desenvolvimento de aeronaves eficientes e competitivas para o mercado futuro (segurança de vôo, conforto, economia de combustível, etc). Esta necessidade se justifica pelos impactos ambientais propriamente ditos e pelas crescentes exigências dos órgãos homologadores da aviação (FAA nos EUA, JAA na União Européia e ANAC no Brasil). A capacitação de recursos humanos para o setor aeronáutico e a simulação computacional para projeto desses sistemas é a principal motivação para o desenvolvimento desta meta física. 
A simulação dos processos de transferência de calor e escoamento transiente compressível nos equipamentos que compõem os sistemas ambientais é de fundamental importância para projeto e análise de seu desempenho.
Este projeto de pesquisa tem como objetivo o desenvolvimento de metodologias para projeto de sistemas ambientais aeronáuticos de alto desempenho, enfatizando a abordagem distribuída (CFD) para satisfazer requisitos mais restritivos dos órgãos homologadores.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Coordenação Meta física: 13 - Desenvolvimento de Metodologias para Projeto de Sistemas Ambientais Aeronáuticos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo de Carregamento de Propelente de Motores de Grande Porte
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O objetivo principal do processamento do propelente é produzir um grão propelente sem defeitos capaz de satisfazer as necessidades balísticas de uma missão específica. Neste sentido, várias precauções devem ser tomadas na aplicação do vácuo e no controle da vazão do propelente no estado líquido (taxa de carregamento ? casting rate), durante o carregamento. 
Sabe-se que os métodos de processamento e o carregamento do propelente influenciam os parâmetros balísticos (empuxo, taxa de queima, etc.) e reológicos (viscosidade final da mistura, índice de pseudoplasticidade, elasticidade, etc) e de propriedades mecânicas do grão propelente sólido obtido. Deste modo, é importante ter um método de predição, pelo menos em parte, do comportamento balístico do propelente em motores de grande porte. Uma área que requer atenção é o estudo do impacto dos métodos de processamento e de carregamento do propelente no desempenho balístico do motor sólido.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: UTILIZAÇÃO DA TÉCNICA DE CFD PARA SIMULAÇÃO DO ESCOAMENTO DE SANGUE EM ARTÉRIA HUMANA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Resumo: A Dinâmica de Fluidos Computacional (CFD) tem sido utilizada como uma ferramenta adicional no estudo do comportamento do fluxo sanguíneo (conhecida como hemodinâmica), permitindo a construção de modelos matemáticos que simulam o sistema cardiovascular. Compreender o escoamento sanguíneo e seu comportamento de fluido não-Newtoniano tem se mostrado primordial para a obtenção de diagnósticos médicos mais eficientes e prognósticos de casos de arteriosclerose e entupimentos de artérias. Sabe-se que o comportamento do sangue varia consideravelmente em função da tensão de cisalhamento na parede das artérias (coronária, carótida, por exemplo), provocando um comportamento característico de fluido não-Newtoniano. Nesse contexto, o objetivo principal deste projeto é a utilização da técnica de CFD para a simulação numérica do escoamento de sangue em regime laminar e transiente considerando diferentes modelos de viscosidade (Power-Law, Carreau e Herschel-Bulkley) para investigar a formação de células de recirculação no escoamento, comportamento da tensão de cisalhamento na parede das artérias, efeito da presença de ramificações e bifurcações. O sistema de equações governantes (massa, quantidade de movimento com relações constitutivas para a viscosidade) será discretizado utilizando o método de volumes finitos com uma formulação segregada empregando o programa Fluent. O acoplamento entre os campos de pressão e velocidade será feito usando o algoritmo SIMPLE. Para incluir o efeito transiente do escoamento (pulsante), será construída uma subrotina em linguagem C que será implementada no código comercial para simular uma condição de contorno de velocidade dependente do tempo na entrada das artérias. Os resultados obtidos com diferentes modelos de viscosidade (Power Law, Herschel-Bulkley, Carreau) serão comparados com dados experimentais disponíveis na literatura a fim de se prever em que condições (faixas de tensão de cisalhamento, gradiente de pressão, configuração geométri

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: sistema de controle de pressurização da cabine (CP

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Neste trabalho apresenta-se uma metodologia de
cálculo para se determinar a vazão de ar na válvula de
exaustão de um avião típico. O ar é insuflado com uma vazão em volume
constante pelo sistema de ar condicionado na parte
superior ao longo de toda a extensão da cabine, e a
seguir é direcionado para a parte inferior (abaixo do
piso) do avião, sendo que a exaustão ocorre na válvula
de saída.
Os resultados se mostraram altamente dependentes de uma
avaliação da vazão de vazamento na cabine, a qual está
relacionada com a razão de pressão entre a pressão
externa e interna e também com a densidade do ar no
interior da cabine.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Thermodynamic Study of an Aircraft Air-Conditioning Air Cycle Machine

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: III NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 3rd NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Publicado em CD-Rom

Abstract. At this work a thermodynamic study of an air-conditioning aircraft air cycle machine
(ACM) is performed. This ACM configuration includes mainly two compact heat exchangers, a
compressor and an expander. The energy to drive this machine comes from the compressed air
bleed from the compressor of the aircraft propulsion turbine. Some design features that affect the
ACM performance will be studied in this work: aircraft Mach number, cabin altitude, cabin
temperature and the percentage of the turbine work absorbed by the exhaust fan. Results obtained
shows that the implemented computational tool that solves the ACM mathematical model allows an
understanding of the ACM performance when flight aircraft and cabin human comfort parameters
are changed to attain an optimized ECS configuration design.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Análise Bidimensional da Proteção Térmica por Ablação

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: III NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 3rd NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Publicado em CD_Rom

Resumo: Este trabalho reporta uma análise de proteção térmica por ablação utilizando uma abordagem
entálpica para mudança de fase em problemas bidimensionais. Na solução numérica deste problema, a
discretização no espaço foi feita utilizando-se o método de elementos finitos de Galerkin com um
procedimento totalmente implícito e iterativo no tempo, para capturar o efeito do calor latente de
ablação durante o desgaste da superfície da proteção térmica. Por fim, os resultados obtidos foram
comparados com a literatura específica, onde foi verificada uma boa concordância.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produtos e Serviços Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteção do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Publicado em CD-Rom

Abstract: One of the approaches for mitigating potential global climate change due to anthropogenic emissions of CO2 and other greenhouse gases is to capture CO2 from fossil fuels (as coal and natural gas). This emission is primarily due to the energy supplies, including the thermal power plants. At this context, this work presents a survey on the carbon dioxide capture technologies from the power plants flue gases. Both post and pre-combustion technologies are described. Results provided in the literature show that the implementation of carbon dioxide capture process has a significant impact in the power plants: efficiency reduction and costs elevation.

Publicado em CD-Rom

Abstract: The present study reports the conjugate laminar natural convection in a discretely heated cavity. The cavity has three protuberant discrete heat sources, equally space, mounted to one vertical wall. The opposite vertical wall and the horizontal faces are assumed to be isothermal and adiabatic, respectively. The conduction in the solid (electronic components) and the convection in the fluid region are solved using an only domain by a coupled way (conjugate problem). The partial differential equations system is solved applying the Galerkin finite element method with an unstructured mesh. To check the numerical results, the Nusselt number values for natural convection in a square cavity (with differentially heated walls) with benchmark solutions and presented a good agreement. The effect of the solid to fluid conductivity ratio on the velocity and temperature profiles was analyzed. To improve the electronic component cooling design, a proposed critical dimensionless temperature difference was calculated as a function of the heat source internal energy generation. Results showed that lower temperature values can be reached depending on the location of the heat source with higher heat dissipation rate. This is extremely important to guarantee that the electronic component operational temperature limits are not been exceed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Determination of the outflow valve opening area of the aircraft cabin pressurization system

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Publicado em CD-rom

Abstract. The cabin pressure control system continuously monitors the ground and flight modes of the airplane (climb, cruise, or descent) as well as holding patterns at various altitudes. It uses this information to allow air to escape continuously from the airplane by further opening or closing the outflow valve. Thus, the cabin internal pressure is controlled by modulating the exhaust airflow through the escape valve (outflow valve). As the airplane changes altitude, the outflow valve repositions itself to allow more or less air to escape. While the external ambient pressure is equivalent to the altitude of 36,000 ft, the cabin pressure is maintained at approximately 8,000 ft due to the physiological human requirements (mainly the respiratory needs). This leads a high differential pressure between the cabin and the external environment implying in more intense structural efforts to the fuselage. The outflow valve is constantly being positioned to maintain cabin pressure as close to sea level as practical, without exceeding a predetermined cabin-to-outside pressure differential. In this context, this work focuses on the determination of the outflow valve opening area of the aircraft cabin pressurization system for ground and flight schedules, considering: (i) the inflow supplied by the air-conditioning packs; (ii) cabin leakages and (iii) the pressure change rate. The cabin leakage is modelled using the orifice compressible flow theory and the inflow rate is constant (determined by the cabin ventilation requirements). Results are obtained using a typical aircraft flight mission (schedule).

Publicado em CD-Rom

Abstract. In the context of aircraft cabin environmental control, the goal of this work is to build a mathematical model of the cabin pressure control system and to simulate it for some important design cases. The developing of the model is based on the recommendation document ARP 1270 (SAE, 2000) with some modifications in order to apply it to a specific aircraft design, developed in academic work. From the model of the cabin pressure control system built for this aircraft, normal flight operation (climb, cruise and descent) and some failure cases are simulated. The first failure event studied is when the outflow valve fails open and the cabin depressurizes. The second one is the failure of the outflow valve in the closed position, with continuous increase of the cabin pressure, and the third failure case is the complete loss of the pneumatic system, another depressurization case. These cases are especially interesting in the initial analysis of the system, allowing the preliminary design of the aircraft's emergency descent profile (depressurizing cases) and safety valve, that prevents great pressure differentials on the cabin (outflow valve fail closed).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Publicado em CD-Rom

Abstract. Pultrusion is one of the manufacturing processes which are used for continuous fabrication of fiber-reinforced polymer composites of constant cross-section. In this process, dry fibrous reinforcement is pulled through a resin bath for resin impregnation. Composite materials possess superior properties such as high strength and stiffness to weight ratio, resistance to environmental deterioration, high electrical insulation and low assembly cost. Over the years, these materials have found increasingly wide applications in a variety of industries including the aerospace and chemical engineerin. More recently, pultruded products are gaining increasing market share in civil infrastructure applications due to their unique advantages over traditional steel and concrete materials. The pultrusion process can be understood as an advection-reaction-diffusion problem modeled by two partial differential equations, energy and a degree of cure transport equations. These equations are coupled by a reactive source-term from the resin curing exothermic reaction. At this work, a two-dimensional parabolic model using the finite element method was employed to determine the temperature and the degree of cure distributions inside the pultruded material with circular cross-section. This numerical study will allow to evaluate the effect of different parameters (such as: fiber volume, pulling speed and die-wall set point temperature) on the degree of cure of the final product composed by epoxy resin reinforced with carbon fiber. Therefore, an adequate knowledge of these characteristics contributes for a better pultrusion process design

ABSTRACT
Numerical investigations were performed to predict
the relationship between the results for ablative
thermal protection of a reentry satellite obtained with
one-dimensional and two-dimensional approach. An
enthalpy approach was implemented in a
computational program where the numerical solution
was obtained using the Galerkin finite element
method, in order to capture the ablation latent heat
effect on the thermal protection surface consumption.
It is conclude that for the analyzed two-dimensional
geometry, the one-dimensional approach can be
employed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
The turbulent backward-facing step flow has been investigating due to its important applications as: diffusers, airfoils with separation, buildings, combustors and turbines blades. Several previous studies have simulated features of the reattachment point under different pressure gradients values imposed by variation of the top wall deflection angle. In this work, this problem is numerically studied using the Realizable k- model and compared with experimental and numerical data. The wall treatment employed is the enhanced wall function. The mathematical model equations (mass conservation, momentum and turbulence model) were solved with finite volume technique and a segregated approach using a commercial code. A mesh refinement procedure is performed to satisfy the grid independence requirement. Numerical results obtained show the reattachment point is influenced by both the top wall deflection angle exhibiting a small deviation (below 3%) relative to the experimental values. It is also showed that a better agreement is obtained to denser mesh as the top wall deflection angle is larger.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Comparison of the Turbulence Models in the Analysis of the Impingement Jet Problem

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: 
Impinging jets are widely used for heating, cooling and drying applications. The jets are generally issued from a nozzle with a circular sections or rectangular slots and accordingly identified as circular jet and slot jet, respectively. In this work, numerical simulations were performed applying the control volume scheme to analyze the flow and heat transfer fields of a jet impinging normally on flat surface. The problem analyzed is air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) of an axisymmetrical circular turbulent jet with Reynolds number equal to 23,000. The turbulence models used were Standard k- , Spalart-Allmaras and V2F models implemented in commercial CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) software. A comparison of the turbulent viscosity results using these three different turbulence models is also shown. To validate the flat plate numerical results, a comparison with available data obtained in the literature is carried out. For the Standard k- turbulence model, two different boundary conditions in the inlet (uniform and power law profiles) were simulated. It is verified that k- model results overpredict the values quantities in comparison with the Spalart-Allmaras and V2F models results.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NEVES JÚNIOR, João Batista Do Porto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This work focuses on a numerical simulation of a fire suppression system in an aircraft cargo compartment, using the halon 1301 (CBrF3) as the fire extinguishing agent. A simple formulation is implemented based on the lumped parameter method to obtain a mathematical model of the problem and a time evolution of the air and halon volumetric concentrations. The resulting differential ordinary equations system is solved using a computational tool with an easy graphical interface and the solution uses a fourth order Runge-Kutta scheme. The developed numerical tool is used to verify the influence of different parameters on the fire suppression system design as: flight altitude, cabin temperature, cabin volume, fuselage leakage area and the air infiltration rate. Numerical and experimental results showed a good agreement for the halon volumetric concentration inside the cargo compartment and satisfy the certification requirements. It is concluded that the model developed in the present work is an important tool to be used in the preliminary analysis during the aircraft conceptual design stage or to modify a pre-existent fire extinguishing system.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
Pultrusion is one of the manufacturing processes which are used for continuous fabrication of fiber-reinforced polymer composites of constant cross-section. In this process, dry fibrous reinforcement is pulled through a resin bath for resin impregnation. Over the years, these materials have found increasingly wide applications in a variety of industries including the aerospace, building, and electronics, once this materials have important characteristic such as high strength and stiffness to weight ratio, resistance to environmental deterioration, high electrical insulation. The pultrusion process can be understood as an advection-reaction-diffusion problem modeled by two partial differential equations: energy and a degree of cure transport equations. These equations are coupled by a reactive source-term from the resin curing exothermic reaction. At this work, it was analyzed two different approaches (elliptic and parabolic models) for the pultrusion process simulation. The results showed good agreement with experimental data and elliptic and parabolic models presented similar predictions of the temperature and degree of cure profiles to higher Peclet number values.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Study of the 2D Slot Jet Impinging in Concave Surface

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 4th National Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
Impingement jet heat transfer has been well established as an effective technique for heating, cooling or drying a target surface and has a variety of engineering applications. In the impingement jet cooling onto the turbine blade inner surface, the curvature effect should be taken into consideration to understand the different phenomena between the flat plate case and the curved impinging surface case. At this work, a numerical study applying the segregated control volume numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the flow and heat transfer field of a jet impinging normally on the concave surface. The problem considered is air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) of a two-dimensional laminar slot jet with Reynolds number ranging from 100 to 1000 and nozzle-to-surface spacing range 0.5 to 10. The effect of nozzle-to-surface spacing on the flow and heat transfer is investigated. To validate the concave surface numerical results, a comparison with literature available data obtained for flat plate is firstly performed. It is verified that the Nusselt number obtained for the concave surface case is larger than the flat plate configuration in the stagnation region of the 2D slot impinging jet.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Simulation of the Flow Over A Backward-Facing Step: Influence Of Turbulence Models On The Corner Eddy And Reattachment Length

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 4th National Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
The turbulent flow over backward-facing step has important characteristics like several
engineering practical flows: diffusers, airfoils with separation, buildings, combustors and turbines
blades. The detachment line of the backward-facing step flow is straight and fixed at the step edge.
There is only one separated flow zone with two opposing eddies. Significant upstream effect
propagation occurs only downstream the separation line. This flow is important to supply data
which can be used to test turbulence models, wall laws and their implementation in computer codes.
In this work, the mathematical model equations (mass conservation, momentum and turbulence
models) were solved with finite volume technique and a segregated approach. The results obtained
show the influence of k-å turbulence models and of wall laws on the corner eddy extension and
reattachment length values.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Study of the Pultrusion Process with Variable Thermal Properties

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 11th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

Pultrusion process has gained significance as a composite manufacturing method over the past few years. It is a continuous process for composite materials with constant cross-sections with a high productivity and cost-effective. Pultrusion of thermosetting matrices consists of two phases, namely impregnation and curing. At first, a fiber creel passes through a resin bath. The fiber impregnated with liquid resin enters a heated die where the elevated temperature induces the curing resin process. Then, the pultruded bar is pulled through the die with a constant speed. The pulling speed, the die temperature, the fiber volume fraction and the thermal properties are important parameters that must be set carefully to obtain a high quality of the final product. At the present work, the carbon/Epoxy system has been simulated with a three-dimensional parabolic model employing the finite element method using thermal properties as a function both of temperature and degree of cure distributions inside the pultruded rectangular bar and making comparison with the assumption of to use constants average thermal properties. Evaluating of both the degree of cure and temperature profiles in different conditions for die-wall set-point temperature was also performed. Results showed that the degree of cure development is delayed for the variables properties case, requiring a larger die length to reach a suitable design value of the degree of cure and cure and temperature's positions in the die is important for to increase the rate degree of cure.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Analysis of Cabling Effects in the Temperature Distribution inElectronic Devices Rack

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 11th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:

The target of this work is to evaluate the effect of the cables in the temperature distribution inside electronic equipment of aircraft racks using CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamic) tool. The cables (wiring) are modeled as a porous media and the continuity, momentum, energy equations are numerically solved in conjunction with the standard k- turbulence model. The finite volume method with a segretated formulation is employed to solve the mathematical model. Four different cases are simulated: the standard case without wiring and with air ventilation shows the baseline airflow and temperature distributions; the second case without ventilation and without wiring indicates that the effect of the natural convection is important; in the third case with constant velocity input, the effect of the porous media is verified through the calculation with several source terms showing that the pressure increase does not affect the temperature distribution; in the last case (constant pressure boundary condition with wiring) several source terms are used and are verified that the velocity magnitude increase in the entry affects significantly the temperature distribution of the components. Each imposed equipment heat flux is evaluated from the experimental temperature results. Numerical average equipment temperature results exhibit an asymptotic behavior as a function of the input airflow velocity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Análise termodinâmica de máquinas de ciclo a ar para aplicação aeronáutica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo
Atualmente, as máquinas de ar condicionado para aplicação aeronáutica utilizam ciclos a ar devido às penalidades relacionadas com peso e volume ocupado. O presente trabalho trata de modelos termodinâmicos de máquinas de ar condicionado ciclo a ar de 3 e 4 rotores aplicadas em aeronaves. Avaliam-se as condições de operação tanto em cruzeiro como em solo, mostrando que o segundo estágio de expansão da máquina 4 rotores provoca um aumento na eficiência termodinâmica do ciclo. Conclui-se que a análise termodinâmica dos ciclos das máquinas de ar condicionado é importante para análise de alternativas durante a fase de anteprojeto.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
This numerical study reports the coupled conduction and natural convection heat
transfer in a discretely heated cavity. The cavity has three protuberant discrete heat sources,
equally space, mounted to one vertical wall. The conduction in the solid (protuberant heat
sources) and the convection in the fluid region are solved using a unique domain by a
coupled way (conjugate problem). The governing steady-state partial differential equations
system is solved applying the segregated finite volume method with an unstructured mesh.
The effects of the solid to fluid conductivity ratio and geometric aspect ratio on the velocity
and temperature profiles were analyzed. Furthermore, results showed that when the
geometric aspect ratio is reduced, more than one recirculation zones appear.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical study of axisymmetric compressible turbulent free jet problem

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVIII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 28th Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
In the present study axisymmetric compressible turbulent free jet problem is
numerically solved. Governing equations are discretized employing the volume finite
method with second order discretization approach. Different turbulence models were
tested using the CFD software Fluent to determine the most suitable model for the
compressible overexpanded turbulent free jet problem. Jet flow conditions were: fully
overexpanded at Mach number 2 and total temperature equal to 677.37K. Computational
results for Mach number, total temperature contours, shock structures were compared
with available experimental data. Results obtained from this investigation indicate that the
k-ω SST turbulence model produced better overall results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Three-dimensional laminar flow over a backward facing step: a numerical investigation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVIII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 28th Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract
Numerical simulations of the three-dimensional flow over a backward-facing
step channel are reported in order to investigate the flow characteristics and threedimensional
effects. Results are presented for laminar air flow for Reynolds number lower
than 1,095. The mathematical model equations (mass conservation and momentum) were
solved with finite volume technique and a segregated approach. A mesh refinement study
is performed to attain the grid independence requirement. Results obtained are compared
to experimental data presenting a good agreement. The numerical results of this work
show a non-linear increase of the reattachment length as also evidenced by the
experimental results extracted from literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A survey of Nusselt number correlations for aircraft thermal anti-icing design

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: João Batista do Porto Neves Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NEVES JÚNIOR, João Batista Do Porto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Impingement jets have been widely used in several engineering applications to heat and/or cool surfaces. Some practical examples include: paper drying, cooling of electrical equipments, tempering and shaping of glass, annealing of metal and plastic sheets, cooling of high-temperature gas turbine blades. In aviation, impingement jets are used in anti-icing systems on leading edge of aircraft wing. Such anti-icing systems use hot air educed from the motor compressor (bleed air). In this work, the important parameters to build a correlation that represents the compressible flow with heat transfer in internal concave curved surfaces of the aircraft wing leading edge were identified using a dimensional analysis. In the literature survey were found many correlations used to evaluate the heat transfer rate of impingement jet flow in aircraft thermal anti-icing systems, thereby the correlations proposed in the revised works were developed for heat transfer problems geometrically not similar to the anti-icing system and only one carried on the compressibility effect (Mach number).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An evaluation of the numerical parameter influencing the laminar impingement jet simulation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 18th ISTP - International Symposium on Transport Phenomena
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 18th International Symposium on Transport Phenomena

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: In this work the influence of the numeric solution techniques has been evaluated on the laminar jet impinging on a hot surface. The effect of solver type, mesh and interpolation schema on Nusselt number has been addressed. The problem considered is air flow (Pr = 0.71) of a round jet impinging onto a hot plate with Reynolds number ranging from 10 to 1,000. A parametric study is performed on triangular and quadrilateral meshes in a variety of mesh densities and considering four interpolations schemas for momentum equations. Moreover, the differences between segregated and coupled solvers for Finite Volume Method are discussed. The results show that the higher is the Reynolds number the higher is the difference between the Nusselt number given by triangular and quadrilateral meshes. The requirements in terms of mesh density to reach mesh independence are lower in the coupled solver than in the segregated one.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX COBEM - International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. The smoke transport due to a fire should be well understood for designing practical smoke management system. Current regulations require that aircraft cargo compartment smoke detectors alarm within one minute of the start of a fire and at a time before the fire has substantially decreased the structural integrity of the airplane. Presently, in-flight tests, which can be costly and time consuming, are required to demonstrate compliance with the regulations. This paper presents a CFD model for smoke dissipation inside the 707 cargo compartment in fire condition. The model can provide information on smoke transport under various conditions. It is also fast running, allowing for simulation of numerous fire scenarios in a short period of time. The conservation equations of heat, mass and momentum transfer were solved using the FLUENT software with a passive scalar approach to model the smoke (CO,CO2 and soot) transport. In order to validate the whole procedure, the results of the simulations with FLUENT are compared with experimental data and the results of a CFD code developed by Sandia National Laboratories. Temperature profiles along the ceiling cargo compartment and smoke concentration are also obtained. It is shown that the proposed method should be useful for designing a smoke management system and the CFD smoke transport model presented has the potential to satisfy the certification process.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical study of heat transfer in a turbulent jet discharging into a cross-flow

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX COBEM - International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Turbulent jets flows discharging into a crossflow are encountered in a variety of applications including pollutant discharges, drying of paper, textiles, combustion chamber design, film cooling of turbine blades and aircraft fluid discharges. The heat transfer and flow characteristics of the jet discharge into a crossflow are complex due to the inherent interactions becoming a good test to turbulence models. The main characteristics of the single jet discharging into a cross-flow are the formation of the counter-rotating bound vortex pair downstream from the jet exit, a horseshoe vortex system in the cross-flow boundary layer upstream from the jet exit, and the creation of wake vortices similar in appearance to those observed in the flow past a bluff body. This wake flow reattaches the jet emerging wall in a downstream distance depending on the jet to crossflow velocity ratio. In the present work, governing equations (mass conservation, momentum, energy and standard k- turbulence model) are discretized using a finite volume approach with a hexahedrical structured mesh to simulate this problem. The pressure and velocity fields are coupled employing the SIMPLE algorithm. Due to the importance for aeronautical applications, present numerical analysis is focused on the influence of the jet to crossflow velocity ratio on the temperature distribution along the reattachment region at the duct wall.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Study of the laminar jet impinging on a flat surface

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX COBEM - International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Impingement jet heat transfer has been well established as an effective technique for heating, cooling or drying a target surface and is employed in many important applications. At this work, a numerical study applying the control volume numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the flow and heat transfer of a impingement jet normal to a flat surface. The convective terms were discretized using differents interpolation schemas to study the influence on local Nusselt number in the impingement wall. The discretized equations were solved by a segregated formulation using the SIMPLE approach for the pressure-velocity coupling. The problem considered is a circular jet laminar air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) with Reynolds number ranging from 100 to 1000 with constant nozzle-to-surface spacing of the H/D = 2. An unstructured mesh with quadrilateral elements were employed to obtain the numerical solution. The influence of radial domain extension in the results is also analyzed for r/D = 2.5, 5, 7.5 and 10. To validate the results, a comparison with available literature data is performed. The results shows that the interpolation schema and the radial domain extension don?t affect the Nusselt number in the studied parameters range.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical study of axisymmetric subsonic turbulent free jet problem

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX COBEM - International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Free jets have been of great interest for many engineering applications as in aerodynamic, thermal, chemical and propulsion systems. In the present study axisymmetric compressible turbulent free jet problem is numerically solved. Governing equations (mass conservation, momentum, energy and turbulence model) are discretized employing the volume finite method with a segregated solver and second order discretization approach. Two different turbulence models were tested Spalart-Allmaras and v2-f using the a CFD tool to determine the most suitable model for the compressible free jet problem. Jet flow conditions were: Mach number 0.6, Reynolds 1.86e6 and total temperature at nozzle exit 316 K. Computational results for decay velocity for each simulated case were compared with available experimental data. Results obtained from this investigation indicate that the v2-f turbulence model produced better overall results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical simulation of an aircraft cargo compartment fire suppression system using CFD tool

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX COBEM - International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: João Batista do Porto Neves Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NEVES JÚNIOR, João Batista Do Porto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. This work focuses on a numerical simulation of a fire suppression system in an aircraft cargo compartment, that uses the halon 131 (CBrF3) as the fire extinguishing agent. The Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) tool has been used to analyze a time-space evolution of the halon volumetric concentration that is the main requirememt in the certification process. This mathematical model also allows to verify the influence of different parameters as infiltration rate and mixture leakage rate on the fire suppression system design. A mesh has been generated involving the cargo compartment domain to solve the governing differential equations. Numerical and experimental results showed a good agreement for the halon volumetric concentration inside the cargo compartment and satisfying the certification requirements. It is concluded that the model developed in the present work is an important tool to be used in the preliminary analysis during the aircraft conceptual design stage or to modify a pre-existent fire extinguishing system.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: CFD Analysis of 90o Round Elbow Duct Fitting Loss Coefficient

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: V NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 5th NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
 Pressure loss in ductworks is an important factor to be considered in design of engineering systems such as power-plants, refineries, HVAC systems to reduce energy costs. Ductwork can be composed by straight ducts and different types of fittings (elbows, converging and diverging tees and wyes). Duct fittings are significant sources of pressure loss in fluid distribution systems. Fitting losses can be even more significant than equipment components such as coils, filters, and dampers. At the present work, a conventional 90o round elbow under turbulent incompressible airflow is studied. Mass, momentum energy and k- turbulence model equations are solved employing the finite volume method. The SIMPLE algorithm is used for the pressure-velocity coupling. In order to validate the numerical tool, the elbow pressure loss coefficient is determined using the same conditions to compare with ASHRAE database. Furthermore, the effect of Reynolds number variation on the elbow pressure loss coefficient is investigated. These results can be useful to perform better preliminary design of air distribution system in aircraft air conditioning that possesses ducts with non-conventional duct cross-sections.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: 3D Conjugate Heat Transfer Study in a Finned Heat Sink

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: V NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 5th NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
Nowadays, thermal control of electronics equipment design is a hard work due to increase in power and size reduction that implies in a large increase in heat flux. In this paper, a conjugate heat transfer analysis (convective + conductive) of a plate fin heat sink with confined impingement cooling is accomplished to verify the influence of
Reynolds number in dissipator performance. The mathematical model equations (continuity, momentum, energy and turbulence model) were numerically solved using finite volume method and compared with experimental results. To reduce numerical errors, an interface conformal mesh is used to improve boundary normal gradient evaluation. The obtained numerical results showed a good agreement with experimental data for small Reynolds numbers. Differences between these values increases with Reynolds number. Like experimental results, numerical values of heat sink thermal resistance decreases when Reynolds number increases, showing that the electronic component works with lower junction temperature for larger Reynolds number.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Study of 3D Laminar Impingement Jet on Flat Surface

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: V NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 5th NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
Jet impingement cooling has been widely used to cool elements exposed to high temperature and high heat flux environments because of its advantages in the effective removal of locally concentrated heat. At this work, a numerical study applying the 3D control volume numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the flow and heat transfer characteristics of a laminar circular jet impinging normally on a flat surface. The problem considered is air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) with Reynolds number ranging from 100 to 1000 and constant nozzle-to-surface spacing of the H/D = 2. An unstructured mesh with hexahedral elements was employed to obtain the numerical solution and the segregated formulation was used for solving the equations (Navier-Stokes and energy equations) with SIMPLE algorithm. A comparison with 2D problem data is performed showing a good agreement with 3D case.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Outflow Duct Length Effect in a Sudden Expansion High Reynolds Laminar Flow

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXIX Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 29th Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract. The separated flows generated by a sudden expansion channel have interesting
characteristics. They are produced by an abrupt change in geometry and have great
importance in many engineering applications, such as flow in diffusers, airfoils with
separation, flow around buildings, combustors, turbines blades, and many flow-relevant
systems. Also, the flow over a backward-facing step is a widely known benchmark problem,
which is used to evaluate the ability of computational fluid dynamics program accuracy to
predict the separated flow behavior. Numerical simulations of laminar flow over a twodimensional
backward-facing step are reported to investigate the influence of the outlet
duct length on recirculation regions downstream of the step. The domain of this work was
based on mid-plane dimensions of Armaly et al (1983) with expansion ratio H/h=1.9423.
The simulations were carried out for Reynolds numbers 800 and 1,000. The mathematical
modeling equations (mass conservation and momentum) were solved by the finite volume
method (FVM) with a segregated approach. A mesh refinement study is performed to
attain the grid independence requirement. Two outflow channel lengths are analyzed. The
numerical results were compared to experimental and numerical data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Trade-Off Study of a Bleedless and a Conventional Air Conditioning Systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XVII Congresso e Exposição Inernacionais de Tecnologia da Mobilidade SAE BRASIL 2008
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of SAE Brasil 2008

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this work is to perform a trade-off study between aircraft air conditioning systems based on conventional technology (Engine Pneumatic Bleed based) and the proposed bleedless architecture, based on the MEA (More Electric Aircraft) and Bleedless Engines concept. The pneumatic bleed system components are thus eliminated and a dedicated compressor serves as the main power supply to the air conditioning and pressurization system. Both the conventional and the proposed ECS architecture are described and the system main parameters are calculated. The aircraft used as baseline for the study is a typical regional jet. The operational characteristics and aspects of costs, weight, energy efficiency, maintainability and impacts on other systems of the aircraft were also considered. The proposed air conditioning architecture is compared to a conventional one in terms of weight, system price and power and fuel consumptions. This work is merely academic and conceptual and does not involve any existing or in development aircraft data from any aircraft manufacturer.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Reynolds Number Effect in The Heat Transfer Mechanisms in Aircraft Hot Air Anti-Ice

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract. The primary means of preventing ice formation on wings and engine inlets for modern commercial transport
aircraft is by extracting hot air from the compressor and blowing it on the inside surface of the leading edge through
small holes drilled in the so-called piccolo tube system. A critical aspect in the design of such system is the prediction
of heat transfer of the impinging jets from the piccolo tube. The correct evaluation of the heat transfer rate in such
devices is of great interest to optimize both the anti-icing performance and the hot air bleeding from the high-pressure
compressor. A review of the literature reveals that there are some experimental and numerical studies that developed
correlations for the average Nusselt number. However, most of the research was performed using a single jet or a
group of jets impinging on a flat slat, which is different from the jet impingement on concave surfaces, as the inside
surface of a wing. Therefore, the objective of the present work is use a commercial CFD software to perform a
parametric study of the jet impingement on concave surfaces. The main goal is determine the effect of the Reynolds
number on the heat transfer process. At the end of the work, a correlation for the average Nusselt number which
account for the Reynolds number is presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A CFD Study of Square Pin Fins Air-Cooled Heat Sink

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: nowadays, finned air-cooled heat sinks are still the most popular means for electronic equipment cooling.
Passive heat sinks are cooled by air natural convection while in the active dissipators the heat is transferred to a
forced convection fan induced air flow. The decrease of the heat dissipation capacity due to the reduction in the heat
exchange area represents a restriction in the evolution of the electronic components compactness. Hence, researches
must be carried out to improve the heat transfer processes simulation and to increase the heat sinks effectiveness. At
the present work, the Reynolds Averaged Navier-Stokes (mass, momentum and energy) and k-e turbulence model
equations are numerically solved employing the finite volume method and a segregated velocity-pressure coupling to
analyze the square pin fins air-cooled heat sinks in a staggered arrangement. A mesh sensitivity study and a
comparison with experimental results were performed to validate the numerical procedure. Pressure drop and heat
transfer coefficient were obtained to evaluate the heat sink performance as a function of the frontal velocity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Simulation of Pulsatile Blood Flow in Rigid Carotid Bifurcation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: hemodynamic simulation studies have been frequently used to gain a better understanding of functional,
diagnostic and therapeutic aspects of the blood flow. Blood can be considered as a pseudoplastic fluid with yield stress
but many factors can influence blood viscosity and its behavior. At the present work, the blood flow in a human carotid
bifurcation is modeled applying the threedimensional, unsteady, incompressible Navier-Stokes equations employing a
power-law viscosity model. The vessel wall is assumed rigid and a periodic velocity condition is imposed at the common
carotid artery (CCA) inlet. The computational 3D domain is discretized using the volume finite method with an
unstructured mesh. Numerical solution is obtained with an implicit transient scheme and the SIMPLE algorithm is
employed for pressure velocity coupling. The influence of the pulsation rate on the fluid flow patterns was studied and
undesirable reverse blood flow regions were also identified.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A CFD Analysis of Heat Transfer in a 3D Backward-Facing Step Laminar Flow

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract: fluid flows over a backward-facing step with or without heat transfer are often used as benchmark problem
for computational fluid dynamic (CFD) codes. Some features of this flow, such as: recirculation zone extensions,
spanwise swirling vortex and Nusselt number distributions on the heated stepped wall present several challenges to
CFD solutions. In this work, 3D heat and fluid flow in a backward-facing step with aspect ratio of 8 and expansion
ratio of 2 are numerically solved by finite volume technique. A segregated coupling of pressure-velocity is employed
and a mesh sensitivity study is performed. The results presented good agreement compared with numerical and
experimental data from literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Academic Works Using CFD Commercial Codes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2008 ESSS South American ANSYS Users Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2008 ESSS South American ANSYS Users Conference

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: this work presents an overview of academic works developed by GSET group (Grupo de Simulação de Escomento e Transferência de Calor) placed at ITA (Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica), São Paulo, Brazil. The GSET facilities are shown and typical problems related to aircraft environmental control systems are discussed (air conditioning ductwork balancing, fire suppression, drain jet, cabin smoke transport, etc.). The main objective is to show that the CFD tool can be extremely useful during the preliminary design of these systems saving cost and time consumptions attributed to experimental tests. Firstly, some validated studies are described showing good agreement with theoretical and/or experimental results. Then, the CFD predictive feature was explored and more realistic problems were simulated (e.g., aircraft fuel tank sloshing, cabin air circulation, bleed hot-air anti-ice system). Results showed that to attain good solutions, the commercial code must be handled carefully requiring a level-headed and well instructed user.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Experimental and Numerical Investigation of Roughness and Three-dimensional Effects on the Flow over Shallow Cavities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 39th AIAA Fluid Dynamics Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of 39th AIAA Fluid Dynamics Conference

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Ramos Fico Jr.
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FICO JR., N. G. C. R.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract:
This paper is aimed at investigating the cavity roughness surface condition and threedimensional
effects, originated due to cavity spanwise finite dimension, on the flow pattern.
Results of the flow topology obtained with roughness added (using sand paper) on the whole
cavity surface and with roughness just in the entrance region were compared. The data
showed that the flow topologies in these situations are not very similar. Two-dimensional
PIV measurements have been conducted at several planes, parallel to the main flow
direction, in order to find out the distance from the middle of the cavity where the threedimensional
effects start to be relevant. Fixed cavity geometry and two values of Reynolds
number were considered. With the purpose of investigating more deeply the threedimensional
effects, a numerical study taking into account the constructive aspects of cavity
model has been started. Some numerical results for the case of two-dimensional cavity with
smooth surface will be presented. A good agreement between numerical and experimental
results was observed. The numerical investigation of three-dimensional effects will be
reported in future works.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Heat Transfer Correlations for Aircraft Anti-Icing System Using Hot Bleed Air

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 11th BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: João Batista do Porto Neves Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NEVES JÚNIOR, João Batista Do Porto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract. Impingement jets have been widely used in several engineering applications to heat and/or cool surfaces. Some practical
examples include: the paper drying, cooling of electrical equipments, tempering and shaping of glass, annealing of metal and
plastic sheets, high-temperature gas turbine blades. In aviation the impingement jet is used in anti-icing systems on leading edge of
aircraft wing, using hot air extracted of the propulsion turbine motor (bleed air). In the literature there is many works concerning to
the heat transfer correlations for impingement jets in flat plates and concave or convex surfaces. At the present work, a critical
review of some correlations available will be performed to verify theirs applicability to the aircraft anti-icing preliminary design. It
was verified that none of the Nusselt number correlations analyzed could be applied to the piccolo tube anti-icing system with
suitable reliability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Study of the Application of V2f Turbulence Model in Axisymmetric Impingement Jet

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 11th BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract. Jet impingement cooling has been widely used to cool elements exposed to high temperature and high heat flux
environments because of its advantages in the effective removal of locally concentrated heat and the easy adjustment to the location
where the cooling is needed. A numerical investigation was performed to predict thermal characteristics in the axisymmetrical
turbulent jet impinging on a flat surface. The problem considered is circular jet airflow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) impinging
onto hot flat plate with Reynolds number equal to 23,000. At this work, a numerical study applying segregated control volume
numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the jet impinging normally on the flat plate. The computations were performed using the
normal velocity relaxation turbulence model (V2F model) implemented in the commercial CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamic)
software. The focus of this work is an analysis of the procedures for mesh generation to attain the range of Yplus values in the
impingement wall recommended for V2F turbulence model. For validation, the computational Nusselt number results have been
compared with experimental data and presented a good agreement.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: CFD Adjusted One-Dimensional Jet Pump Model

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract. This work deals with the numerical simulation of an isothermal fluid flow in an axisymmetric jet pump using
a CFD tool. Considering an incompressible constant properties turbulent flow, the numerical solution was obtained
applying a segregated approach with finite volume discretization of the governing equations. The one-dimensional loss
coefficients were evaluated using the numerical results. The one-dimensional jet pump model results were compared
with experimental results for suction flow rate, head ratios and efficiencies. This adjusted one-dimensional model is
important to the preliminary design of the jet pump.
